code: @Manual{,   title = {rbrsa: Fetch Turkish Banking Sector Data from BRSA (BDDK)},   author = {Ozan Bakis},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/obakis/rbrsa}, }

what: Fetch Turkish Banking Sector Data from BRSA (BDDK)
title: Fetch Turkish Banking Sector Data from BRSA (BDDK)
text: R package programmatic access Turkish banking sector data Turkish Banking Regulation Supervision Agency (BRSA, known BDDK Turkish). package provides R users clean interface fetch monthly quarterly banking statistics, financial reports, sectoral indicators directly BRSA’s official APIs.

title: Fetch Turkish Banking Sector Data from BRSA (BDDK)
text: Direct API access BRSA monthly bulletins (17 financial tables) Quarterly Finturk data city-level granularity (7 tables, 82 cities including ‘HEPSİ’ cities) Consistent parameter interface data sources Built-metadata tables, banking groups, cities Multiple export formats: RDS, CSV, Excel via save_data() Returns base R data frames ready analysis

title: Fetch Turkish Banking Sector Data from BRSA (BDDK)
text: Unlike configuration-heavy approaches, bddkR (based bddkdata, Python package), rbrsa uses programmatic design dynamically extracts column structures API responses maintaining stable user interface. approach reduces maintenance burden adapts BRSA API changes.

title: Fetch Turkish Banking Sector Data from BRSA (BDDK)
text: bddkR (R): Uses manual configuration translations column mappings bddk (Python): Provides similar functionality Python users bddkdata (Python): Provides similar functionality Python/pandas users pybrsa (Python, forthcoming): Python companion package consistent API

title: Fetch Turkish Banking Sector Data from BRSA (BDDK)
text: can install CRAN development version can installed GitHub:
code: install.packages("rbrsa") #install.packages("pak") pak::pkg_install("obakis/rbrsa")

title: Fetch Turkish Banking Sector Data from BRSA (BDDK)
text: rbrsa package retrieves tablesfrom two distinct publication portals maintained Turkish Banking Regulation Supervision Agency (BDDK). portals official sources, organize data differently: Monthly Bulletin Portal provides high-level, summary reports designed general consumption quick overviews monthly trends without geographic coverage. Finturk Data System provides granular, detailed data, including statistics broken province, whereas standard Monthly Bulletin offers national-level aggregates. Note: time single grup_kod allowed. API allows using multiple grup_kod well download bank groups. added future versions.
code: library(rbrsa) ## Explore available tables list_tables("bddk") # list_tables("bddk","tr") list_tables("finturk")  # list_tables("finturk", "tr") list_groups("bddk")   list_groups("bddk","tr")   list_groups("finturk")  ## Monthly data (Table 15: Ratios) data <- fetch_bddk(2024, 1, 2024, 3, table_no = 15, grup_kod = 10001)  ## Quarterly Finturk data q_data <- fetch_finturk(2024, 3, 2024, 9, table_no = 1, grup_kod = 10007)  ## Save results temp_file <- tempfile(fileext = ".csv") # filenames is without extension save_data(q_data, temp_file, format = "csv")

what: Fetch multiple period table from BDDK website Fetches BDDK data for a range of months by calling fetch_bddk1 iteratively. — fetch_bddk
title: Fetch multiple period table from BDDK website Fetches BDDK data for a range of months by calling fetch_bddk1 iteratively. — fetch_bddk
text: Fetch multiple period table BDDK website Fetches BDDK data range months calling fetch_bddk1 iteratively.

title: Fetch multiple period table from BDDK website Fetches BDDK data for a range of months by calling fetch_bddk1 iteratively. — fetch_bddk
code: fetch_bddk(   start_year,   start_month,   end_year,   end_month,   table_no,   grup_kod = 10001,   currency = "TL",   lang = "en",   delay = 0.5,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Fetch multiple period table from BDDK website Fetches BDDK data for a range of months by calling fetch_bddk1 iteratively. — fetch_bddk
text: start_year, end_year Starting/ending year (YYYY). start_month, end_month Starting/ending month (1-12). table_no Table number fetch (1-17). default. Use list_tables source = "bddk" see available options. grup_kod Group code (10001-10016). Default 10001. Use list_groups source = "bddk" see available options. currency Currency code ("TL" "USD"). Default "TL". lang Language ("en" "tr"). Default "en". delay Delay requests seconds. Default 0.5. verbose Print progress messages. Default TRUE.

title: Fetch multiple period table from BDDK website Fetches BDDK data for a range of months by calling fetch_bddk1 iteratively. — fetch_bddk
text: Combined data frame "fetch_range" attribute.

title: Fetch multiple period table from BDDK website Fetches BDDK data for a range of months by calling fetch_bddk1 iteratively. — fetch_bddk
code: # \donttest{   # Fetch multiple months   my_dat <- fetch_bddk(2024, 1, 2024, 3, table_no = 15) #> Fetching table 15 for 3 months: 2024-01 to 2024-03 #> [1/3] 2024-01... 32 rows #> [2/3] 2024-02... 32 rows #> [3/3] 2024-03... 32 rows # }

title: Fetch single period table from BDDK website Retrieves data for a specific table, month, and grup_kod from the BDDK Monthly Bulletin. — fetch_bddk1
text: year Year 4-digit integer (YYYY). month Month integer (1-12). table_no Table number fetch (1-17). default. Use list_tables source = "bddk" see available options. grup_kod Group code (10001-10010). Default 10001. Use list_groups source = "bddk" see available options. currency Currency code ("TL" "USD"). Default "TL". lang Language ("en" "tr"). Default "en".

what: Fetch multiple period Finturk data Fetches Finturk data for a range of quarters by calling fetch_finturk1 iteratively. — fetch_finturk
title: Fetch multiple period Finturk data Fetches Finturk data for a range of quarters by calling fetch_finturk1 iteratively. — fetch_finturk
text: Fetch multiple period Finturk data Fetches Finturk data range quarters calling fetch_finturk1 iteratively.

title: Fetch multiple period Finturk data Fetches Finturk data for a range of quarters by calling fetch_finturk1 iteratively. — fetch_finturk
code: fetch_finturk(   start_year,   start_month,   end_year,   end_month,   table_no,   grup_kod = 10001,   il = 0,   delay = 0.5,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Fetch multiple period Finturk data Fetches Finturk data for a range of quarters by calling fetch_finturk1 iteratively. — fetch_finturk
text: start_year, end_year Starting/ending year (YYYY). start_month, end_month Starting/ending month (3,6,9,12). table_no Table number fetch (1-7). default. Use list_tables source = "finturk" see available options. grup_kod Group code (10001-10007). Default 10001. Use list_groups source = "finturk" see available options. il plaka (license plate) number (0-81, 99). Default 0. delay Delay requests seconds. Default 0.5. verbose Print progress messages. Default TRUE.

title: Fetch multiple period Finturk data Fetches Finturk data for a range of quarters by calling fetch_finturk1 iteratively. — fetch_finturk
text: Combined data frame "fetch_range" attribute.

title: Fetch multiple period Finturk data Fetches Finturk data for a range of quarters by calling fetch_finturk1 iteratively. — fetch_finturk
code: # \donttest{   # Fetch multiple quarters   my_data <- fetch_finturk(2024, 3, 2024, 9, table_no = 1) #> Fetching table 1 for 3 quarterly periods: 2024-03 to 2024-09 #> [1/3] 2024-03... 82 rows #> [2/3] 2024-06... 82 rows #> [3/3] 2024-09... 82 rows # }

what: Fetch single period Finturk data — fetch_finturk1
title: Fetch single period Finturk data — fetch_finturk1
text: Retrieves quarterly data BDDK Finturk website

title: Fetch single period Finturk data — fetch_finturk1
code: fetch_finturk1(year, month, table_no, grup_kod = 10001, il = 0)

title: Fetch single period Finturk data — fetch_finturk1
text: year Year 4-digit integer (YYYY). month Month integer (3,6,9,12 quarterly data). table_no Table number fetch (1-7). default. grup_kod Group code (10001-1007). Default 10001. il plaka (license plate) number (0-81, 99). Default 0. 0=HEPSİ (Cities), 1=Adana, 6=Ankara, 34=İstanbul, 35=İzmir, etc. See list_cities full list.

title: Fetch single period Finturk data — fetch_finturk1
text: Data frame data period metadata.

title: Fetch single period Finturk data — fetch_finturk1
code: # \donttest{   # Fetch Table 1 (Loans) for Q1 2024   data <- fetch_finturk1(2024, 3, 1) # }

what: Convert plaka (license plate number) to city code Maps Turkish license plate numbers to city names used in the Finturk API. — plaka_to_city
title: Convert plaka (license plate number) to city code Maps Turkish license plate numbers to city names used in the Finturk API. — plaka_to_city
text: Convert plaka (license plate number)  city code Maps Turkish license plate numbers city names used Finturk API.

title: Convert plaka (license plate number) to city code Maps Turkish license plate numbers to city names used in the Finturk API. — plaka_to_city
code: plaka_to_city(plaka)

title: Convert plaka (license plate number) to city code Maps Turkish license plate numbers to city names used in the Finturk API. — plaka_to_city
text: plaka license plate number (0 "HEPSI", 1-81 cities, 999 "YURT DISI")

title: Convert plaka (license plate number) to city code Maps Turkish license plate numbers to city names used in the Finturk API. — plaka_to_city
text: City code CAPS required API

title: Convert plaka (license plate number) to city code Maps Turkish license plate numbers to city names used in the Finturk API. — plaka_to_city
code: plaka_to_city(6)   # "ANKARA" #> [1] "ANKARA" plaka_to_city(34)  # "ISTANBUL" #> [1] "İSTANBUL" plaka_to_city(0)   # "HEPSI" #> [1] "HEPSİ"

what: Save Fetched Data to Multiple Formats — save_data
title: Save Fetched Data to Multiple Formats — save_data
text: Save Fetched Data Multiple Formats

title: Save Fetched Data to Multiple Formats — save_data
code: save_data(df, filename = NULL, format = "rds")

title: Save Fetched Data to Multiple Formats — save_data
text: df Data frame save (fetch_range attribute auto-naming). filename Base name output file (without extension). format Output format: "rds", "csv", "xlsx". Default "rds".

title: Save Fetched Data to Multiple Formats — save_data
text: Full file path (invisibly).

title: Save Fetched Data to Multiple Formats — save_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   my_data <- fetch_bddk1(2024, 1, 15)   temp_file <- tempfile(fileext = ".csv")   save_data(my_data, temp_file, format = "csv") } # }

title: rbrsa 0.1.0
text: Initial release core functionality Support 17 monthly BRSA tables Support 7 quarterly Finturk tables Built-metadata tables, groups, cities Export functions RDS, CSV, Excel formats
